body_html:
Our CI continuously build our docker images using our docker files without any issues.

So let's try something simpler to verify if your machine is setup correctly.
Could you try using the docker image checked into dockerhub tf repository? This is to verify if you have correct docker setup:

nvidia-docker run -it tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-gpu bash
python
import tensorflow as tf
tf.test.is_gpu_available()

If the above works, then probably there is some issues with the environment variables.

body:
Our CI continuously build our docker images using our docker files without any issues.

So let's try something simpler to verify if your machine is setup correctly.
Could you try using the docker image checked into dockerhub tf repository? This is to verify if you have correct docker setup:

```
nvidia-docker run -it tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-gpu bash
python
import tensorflow as tf
tf.test.is_gpu_available()
```

If the above works, then probably there is some issues with the environment variables.
